headline: Qualcomm Stock Falls After Downgrade. The Apple Supplier Has an iPhone Problem.
summary: Qualcomm  shares have had a strong start to the year but a decline in spending from longtime customer  Apple  could knock the chip maker off course, according to analysts at  Mizuho  Securities.  The firm downgraded Qualcomm stock to Neutral from Outperform and lowered its price target to $175 from $200 in a research note Friday.  A weak smartphone market, plus Apple manufacturing more components in-house, could weigh on the company over the next few years, Mizuho argued.

headline: ON Semiconductor (ON) Is Up 12.4% After Expanding Buybacks And Advancing EU Power-Chip Capacity - What's Changed
summary: In recent days, ON Semiconductor announced a greatly expanded US$6.00 billion share repurchase authorization, alongside progress on EU‑backed capacity expansion in Dresden and collaboration with GlobalFoundries on 650V Gallium Nitride power semiconductors. This combination of capital returns and power-semiconductor innovation highlights ON Semiconductor’s effort to strengthen its position in higher-value markets despite cyclical end‑market softness. Now we’ll explore how the enlarged share...

headline: Aehr Test Systems: Dismal Quarter Offset By Strong Bookings Projections - Hold
summary: Aehr Test Systems Q2/FY2026 miss, margin lows, cash burn, and order delays, plus FY2027 AI customer upside. See here for more details.
